Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he pursued, and the ideological struggle between those ideals and his family’s declining fortunes.

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as "Hardcore" (1979) by Jim Sharman but I was pretty disappointed by that one. I think I prefer “Les Valseuses” as I enjoy the story with its crazy and silly vibes. If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll, Eric Campbell, and George Wood with Fowler Vignola at the helm, Raiders Of Ghost City is destined to go down in history as one of the best-costume ghost flicks ever made! A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The film, based on a short story by Raymond Carver, was directed by John Erick Dowdle (Quarantine, Breach and The Last House on the Left).
A story of a man who is living his life but also a story of a boy and his quest to love his father.
